verses.text: When a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* hath \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* a \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, and \w married|strong="H1166"\w* her, and it come to pass that she \w find|strong="H4672"\w* no \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* in his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, because he hath \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w some|strong="H1697"\w* \w uncleanness|strong="H6172"\w* in her: then let him \w write|strong="H3789"\w* her a \w bill|strong="H5612"\w* of \w divorcement|strong="H3748"\w*, and \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \add it\add* in her \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, and \w send|strong="H7971"\w* her out of his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.\f + \fr 24.1 \ft some…: Heb. matter of nakedness\f*\f + \fr 24.1 \ft divorcement: Heb. cutting off\f*
And when she is departed \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, she may \w go|strong="H1980"\w* and be \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w man’s|strong="H0376"\w* \add wife\add*.

And \add if\add* the \w latter|strong="H0314"\w* \w husband|strong="H0376"\w* \w hate|strong="H8130"\w* her, and \w write|strong="H3789"\w* her a \w bill|strong="H5612"\w* of \w divorcement|strong="H3748"\w*, and \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* \add it\add* in her \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, and \w sendeth|strong="H7971"\w* her out of his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*; or if the \w latter|strong="H0314"\w* \w husband|strong="H0376"\w* \w die|strong="H4191"\w*, which \w took|strong="H3947"\w* her \add to be\add* his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*;

Her \w former|strong="H7223"\w* \w husband|strong="H1167"\w*, which sent her \w away|strong="H7971"\w*, \w may|strong="H3201"\w* not \w take|strong="H3947"\w* her \w again|strong="H7725"\w* to be his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, \w after|strong="H0310"\w* that she is \w defiled|strong="H2930"\w*; for that \add is\add* \w abomination|strong="H8441"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and thou shalt not cause the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* to \w sin|strong="H2398"\w*, which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* thee \add for\add* an \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w*.

¶ When a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* hath \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* a \w new|strong="H2319"\w* \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, he shall not go \w out|strong="H3318"\w* to \w war|strong="H6635"\w*, neither shall he be \w charged|strong="H5674"\w* with any \w business|strong="H1697"\w*: \add but\add* he shall be \w free|strong="H5355"\w* at \w home|strong="H1004"\w* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w*, and shall cheer \w up|strong="H8055"\w* his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* which he hath \w taken|strong="H3947"\w*.\f + \fr 24.5 \ft neither…: Heb. not any thing shall pass upon him\f*

¶ No man shall \w take|strong="H2254"\w* the \w nether|strong="H7347"\w* or the upper \w millstone|strong="H7393"\w* to \w pledge|strong="H2254"\w*: for he \w taketh|strong="H2254"\w* \add a man’s\add* \w life|strong="H5315"\w* to \w pledge|strong="H2254"\w*.

¶ If a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* be \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w stealing|strong="H1589"\w* \w any|strong="H5315"\w* of his \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and maketh \w merchandise|strong="H6014"\w* of him, or \w selleth|strong="H4376"\w* him; then that \w thief|strong="H1590"\w* shall \w die|strong="H4191"\w*; and thou shalt \w put|strong="H1197"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w away|strong="H1197"\w* from \w among|strong="H7130"\w* you.

¶ Take \w heed|strong="H8104"\w* in the \w plague|strong="H5061"\w* of \w leprosy|strong="H6883"\w*, that thou \w observe|strong="H8104"\w* \w diligently|strong="H3966"\w*, and \w do|strong="H6213"\w* according to all that the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w* the \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w* shall \w teach|strong="H3384"\w* you: as I \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* them, \add so\add* ye shall \w observe|strong="H8104"\w* to \w do|strong="H6213"\w*.

\w Remember|strong="H2142"\w* what the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w did|strong="H6213"\w* unto \w Miriam|strong="H4813"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, after that ye were come \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* out of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.

¶ When thou dost \w lend|strong="H5383"\w* thy \w brother|strong="H7453"\w* \w any|strong="H3972"\w* \w thing|strong="H4859"\w*, thou shalt not \w go|strong="H0935"\w* into his \w house|strong="H1004"\w* to \w fetch|strong="H5670"\w* his \w pledge|strong="H5667"\w*.\f + \fr 24.10 \ft lend…: Heb. lend the loan of any thing to, etc\f*

Thou shalt \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* \w abroad|strong="H2351"\w*, and the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* to whom thou dost \w lend|strong="H5383"\w* shall bring \w out|strong="H3318"\w* the \w pledge|strong="H5667"\w* \w abroad|strong="H2351"\w* unto thee.
And if the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add be\add* \w poor|strong="H6041"\w*, thou shalt not \w sleep|strong="H7901"\w* with his \w pledge|strong="H5667"\w*:

In any \w case|strong="H7725"\w* thou shalt \w deliver|strong="H7725"\w* him the \w pledge|strong="H5667"\w* \w again|strong="H7725"\w* when the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* goeth \w down|strong="H0935"\w*, that he may \w sleep|strong="H7901"\w* in his own \w raiment|strong="H8008"\w*, and \w bless|strong="H1288"\w* thee: and it shall be \w righteousness|strong="H6666"\w* unto thee \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

¶ Thou shalt not \w oppress|strong="H6231"\w* an hired \w servant|strong="H7916"\w* \add that is\add* \w poor|strong="H6041"\w* and \w needy|strong="H0034"\w*, \add whether he be\add* of thy \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w*, or of thy \w strangers|strong="H1616"\w* that \add are\add* in thy \w land|strong="H0776"\w* within thy \w gates|strong="H8179"\w*:

At his \w day|strong="H3117"\w* thou shalt \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \add him\add* his \w hire|strong="H7939"\w*, neither shall the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* go \w down|strong="H0935"\w* upon it; for he \add is\add* \w poor|strong="H6041"\w*, and \w setteth|strong="H5375"\w* his \w heart|strong="H5315"\w* upon it: lest he \w cry|strong="H7121"\w* against thee unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and it be \w sin|strong="H2399"\w* unto thee.\f + \fr 24.15 \ft setteth…: Heb. lifteth his soul unto it\f*

The \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w* shall not be put to \w death|strong="H4191"\w* for the \w children|strong="H1121"\w*, neither shall the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* be put to \w death|strong="H4191"\w* for the \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*: every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* shall be put to \w death|strong="H4191"\w* for his own \w sin|strong="H2399"\w*.

¶ Thou shalt not \w pervert|strong="H5186"\w* the \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w* of the \w stranger|strong="H1616"\w*, \add nor\add* of the \w fatherless|strong="H3490"\w*; nor \w take|strong="H2254"\w* a \w widow’s|strong="H0490"\w* \w raiment|strong="H0899"\w* to \w pledge|strong="H2254"\w*:

But thou shalt \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* that thou wast a \w bondman|strong="H5650"\w* in \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*, and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w redeemed|strong="H6299"\w* thee thence: therefore I \w command|strong="H6680"\w* thee to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*.

¶ When thou cuttest \w down|strong="H7114"\w* thine \w harvest|strong="H7105"\w* in thy \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, and hast \w forgot|strong="H7911"\w* a \w sheaf|strong="H6016"\w* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, thou shalt not go \w again|strong="H7725"\w* to \w fetch|strong="H3947"\w* it: it shall be for the \w stranger|strong="H1616"\w*, for the \w fatherless|strong="H3490"\w*, and for the \w widow|strong="H0490"\w*: that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* may \w bless|strong="H1288"\w* thee in all the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of thine \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*.

When thou \w beatest|strong="H2251"\w* thine olive \w tree|strong="H2132"\w*, thou shalt not go over the \w boughs|strong="H6286"\w* \w again|strong="H0310"\w*: it shall be for the \w stranger|strong="H1616"\w*, for the \w fatherless|strong="H3490"\w*, and for the \w widow|strong="H0490"\w*.\f + \fr 24.20 \ft go…: Heb. bough it after thee\f*

When thou \w gatherest|strong="H1219"\w* the grapes of thy \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*, thou shalt not \w glean|strong="H5953"\w* \add it\add* \w afterward|strong="H0310"\w*: it shall be for the \w stranger|strong="H1616"\w*, for the \w fatherless|strong="H3490"\w*, and for the \w widow|strong="H0490"\w*.\f + \fr 24.21 \ft afterward: Heb. after thee\f*

And thou shalt \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* that thou wast a \w bondman|strong="H5650"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*: therefore I \w command|strong="H6680"\w* thee to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*.
